ovdesc.p: This table is used to define all possible Input values allowed to the fields defined in EB.TABLE.DEFINITION. Records created in this EB.TABLE.VETTING application is linked to VETTING.TABLE field in EB.TABLE.DEFINITION.
If GENDER is the FIELD.NAME defined in EB.TABLE.DEFINITION and values allowed in VETTING.TABLE field are MALE and FEMALE, then,
a) Two records with ID as MALE and FEMALE can be created in this application.
b) In the VETTING.TABLE field of EB.TABLE.DEFINITION, these ID's can be provided, delimited with '/' (example, as MALE/FEMALE).

desc.p: Description: The field DESCRIPTION holds the description of the ID which will be used for enrichment purpose.
Description provided in this field will be displayed as an enrichment against the User input to the field where VETTING.TABLE is defined in EB.TABLE.DEFINITION.
3-35 type A (alphanumeric) characters. Multilanguage field. Mandatory input.
Holds the id of the template.
Any alphanumeric characters can be used.
